post.description:
Use this API to create a new contact in an [address book](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/4471544949389). During an active engagement, the Zoom desktop client will display information from the address book if that customer is a contact in the address book. If the consumer is not in the address book, agents can add a new contact and choose which address book the contact belongs to. 

 

**Scopes:** `contact_center_contact:write:admin`

**Granular Scopes:** `contact_center:write:address_book_contact:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `Light`

parameters.name: addressBookId
parameters.description: The address book's ID.

phone_numbers.description: The contact's phone numbers. You must provide this field and/or the `email` field when you create a contact.

emails.description: The contact's email addresses. You must provide this field and/or the `phone_numbers` field when you create a contact.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `2102`
The "email" and/or "phone_numbers" field cannot be an empty value.

get.description:
Get a list of system statuses. Admins can create system statuses, such as **Maintenance**.  

**Scopes:** `contact_center_preference:read:admin`

**Granular Scopes:** `contact_center:read:list_system_statues:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items returned per page.

parameters.name: status_category
parameters.description:
The status's category.

* `agent_status` - User's system statuses.

* `queue_opt_out_and_not_ready_status` - User's **Queue Opt-Out** and **Not Ready** reasons. **Not Ready** reasons are referenced by field `sub_status_name` in the Users APIs, such as [List users' profiles](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/contact-center/apis/#operation/users).

next_page_token.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token will be returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

total_records.description: The total number of all the records available across pages.

status_name.description:
The user's [availability status](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/4470584918541-Setting-availability-status). 
* Offline. 
* Ready. 
* Not Ready. 
* Occupied. 
* A custom user status, like **Lunch**.

status_type.description: The status's type, used to determine default or custom status.

status_category.description:
The status's category.

* `agent_status` - User's system statuses.

* `queue_opt_out_and_not_ready_status` - User's **Queue Opt-Out** and **Not Ready** reasons. **Not Ready** reasons are referenced by field `sub_status_name` in the Users APIs, such as [List users' profiles](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/contact-center/apis/#operation/users).

enable.description: Only applicable to a status with the `queue_opt_out_and_not_ready_status` category. If enabled, the agent can set the status as a sub-status for **Not Ready** or **Queue Opt Out**.

status_assigned_queues.description: Information about the queues that are using the 'Not Ready' or opt out of queue status.

sub_dispositions.description: For `single` dispositions, this field can be ignored. For `multi_level` dispositions, there must be at least one subdisposition. There can be up to 500, and each parent node can have up to 20 child nodes. Child nodes can only have up to 4 levels.

The index of the parent node that the current node belongs to. 
If it is `0`, it means that the current node belongs to the root node.
If the parent index does not exist, the node will be discarded.

put.description:
Controls the recording state for an engagement.

This request is only valid for video and voice engagements. Calling this API for other channel types is invalid.

Acceptance of a request and response of `HTTP 204 No Content` only ensures there were no validation errors with the request.

**Scopes:** `contact_center_engagement:write:admin`

**Granular Scopes:** `contact_center:update:engagement_recording_control:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: engagementId
parameters.description: The engagement event's unique ID.

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: The command for the recording control.

204.description: **HTTP Status:** `204` **No Content** Request accepted for processing with no validation errors. This does not imply successful execution of the command.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `2814`
Cannot use this recording control command with this engagement's channel type.
**Error Code:** `2815`
The engagement is not assigned to an agent. It is not being recorded.
**Error Code:** `2818`
Cannot change recording state from {current_state} to {command_state}.
**Error Code:** `2819`
Recording is stopped.
**Error Code:** `2808`
Recording is in progress. There is no need to open it again.
**Error Code:** `2809`
Start recording first. Cannot be converted to {state}.
**Error Code:** `2810`
No need to repeat the operation, the current state is already {state}.
**Error Code:** `2812`
The recording control's current state is {current_state}, and it cannot be converted to {command_state}.
**Error Code:** `300`
Invalid request.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `20006`
Account not found.
**Error Code:** `2816`
The system could not find the session for the engagement.
**Error Code:** `2817`
There is no recording for this engagement.
**Error Code:** `2901`
Engagement does not exist: {0}.
**Error Code:** `2906`
There are not any agents on the call.

409.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `409`
Conflict **Error Code:** `2907`
There was a problem processing the recording control request.
**Error Code:** `2908`
The operation was partially completed. Try again.
**Error Code:** `2909`
There was a problem processing the recording control request.

queues_count.description: The number of queues using the closure set.

flows_count.description: The number of flows using the closure set.

closure_hour_type.description:
The closure's time type. 
* `1` — All day. 
* `2` — Customized time.

start_time.description: The closure's start time and date in ISO 8601 format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z', or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'TZD'.

end_time.description: The closure's end time and date in ISO 8601 format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z', or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'TZD'.

recurring_frequency.description:
The frequency of a closure's recurrence. 
* `0` — Never. 
* `1` — Annually. 
* `2` — Monthly. 
* `3` — Weekly.

recurring_frequency_type.description:
The closure time's type of recurrence. This applies to `Annually`, `Monthly` and `Weekly` repeat frequency. It returns only for the not `Never` recurrence type. 
* `1` — Specific. 
* `2` — Customized.

recurring_month.description:
The recurrence month. It returns only for the `Annually` recurrence type. 
* `1` — January 
* `2` — February 
* `3` — March 
* `4` — April 
* `5` — May 
* `6` — June 
* `7` — July 
* `8` — August 
* `9` — September 
* `10` — October 
* `11` — November 
* `12` — December

recurring_week_interval.description: The number of weekly recurrences. It returns only for the `Customized` recurrence time types. When it is `Annually/Customized` or `Monthly/Customized` type, the minimum value is `1` and the maximum value is `5`. When it is `Weekly/Customized` type, the minimum value is `1` and the maximum value is `12`.

recurring_days_of_week.description:
The week days of a recurrence. It returns only for the `Weekly/Customized`, the `Weekly/Specific`, the `Annually/Customized` and the `Monthly/Customized` recurrence time types. When the type is "`Weekly/Customized`", there may be multiple values. 
* `1` — Monday 
* `2` — Tuesday 
* `3` — Wednesday 
* `4` — Thursday 
* `5` — Friday 
* `6` — Saturday 
* `7` — Sunday

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `3602`
Timezone does not exist.
**Error Code:** `3702`
The closure name has already been duplicated: $closure_name.
**Error Code:** `3703`
The end time should be greater than the start time.
**Error Code:** `3704`
The "recurring_frequency_type" should not be empty when the "recurring_frequency" is not "Never".
**Error Code:** `3705`
The \"start_time\" and \"end_time\" must be in the same year when the \"recurring_frequency\" is the \"Annually\".
**Error Code:** `3706`
The "start_time" and "end_time" must be in the same month when the "recurring_frequency" is the "Monthly".
**Error Code:** `3707`
The "start_time" and "end_time" must be in the same week when the "recurring_frequency" is the "Weekly".
**Error Code:** `3708`
The "recurring_week_interval" should not be empty when the "recurring_frequency_type" type is "Customized".
**Error Code:** `3709`
The "recurring_days_of_week" should not be empty when the "recurring_frequency_type" type is "Customized".
**Error Code:** `3710`
The "recurring_month" should not be empty when the type is "Annually/Customized".
**Error Code:** `3711`
The "recurring_week_interval" should between "1" and "5" when the "recurring_frequency" type is "Annually" or "Monthly".
**Error Code:** `3712`
The "start_time" and "end_time" must match the "timezone": $start_time/$end_time.
**Error Code:** `3603`
The name already exists.

end_time.description: The closure's end time and date in ISO 8601 format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z', or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'TZD'.

recurring_frequency.description:
The frequency of a closure's recurrence. 
* `0` — Never. 
* `1` — Annually. 
* `2` — Monthly. 
* `3` — Weekly.

recurring_frequency_type.description:
The closure time's recurrence type. This applies to `Annually`, `Monthly` and `Weekly` recurrence frequency. It returns for recurrence types that are not `Never`. 
* `1` — Specific. 
* `2` — Customized.

recurring_month.description:
The recurrence month. It returns only for the `Annually` recurrence type. 
* `1` — January 
* `2` — February 
* `3` — March 
* `4` — April 
* `5` — May 
* `6` — June 
* `7` — July 
* `8` — August 
* `9` — September 
* `10` — October 
* `11` — November 
* `12` — December

recurring_week_interval.description: The number of weekly recurrences. It returns only for the `Customized` recurrence time types. When the recurrence type is either `Annually/Customized` or `Monthly/Customized` type, the minimum value is `1` and the maximum value is `5`. When it is `Weekly/Customized` type, the minimum value is `1` and the maximum value is `12`.

recurring_days_of_week.description:
The recurrence's week days. It returns only for the `Weekly/Customized`, the `Weekly/Specific`, the `Annually/Customized`, and the `Monthly/Customized` recurrence time types. When the recurrence type is "`Weekly/Customized`", there may be multiple values. 
* `1` — Monday 
* `2` — Tuesday 
* `3` — Wednesday 
* `4` — Thursday 
* `5` — Friday 
* `6` — Saturday 
* `7` — Sunday

**Error Code:** `3703`
The end time should be greater than the start time.
**Error Code:** `3704`
The "recurring_frequency_type" should not be empty when the "recurring_frequency" is not "Never".
**Error Code:** `3705`
The \"start_time\" and \"end_time\" must be in the same year when the \"recurring_frequency\" is the \"Annually\".
**Error Code:** `3706`
The "start_time" and "end_time" must be in the same month when the "recurring_frequency" is the "Monthly".
**Error Code:** `3707`
The "start_time" and "end_time" must be in the same week when the "recurring_frequency" is the "Weekly".
**Error Code:** `3708`
The "recurring_week_interval" should not be empty when the "recurring_frequency_type" type is "Customized".
**Error Code:** `3709`
The "recurring_days_of_week" should not be empty when the "recurring_frequency_type" type is "Customized".
**Error Code:** `3710`
The "recurring_month" should not be empty when the type is "Annually/Customized".
**Error Code:** `3711`
The "recurring_week_interval" should between "1" and "5" when the "recurring_frequency" type is "Annually" or "Monthly".
**Error Code:** `3712`
The "start_time" and "end_time" must match the "timezone": $start_time/$end_time.

**Error Code:** `3906`

download_url.description:
The URL to download the recording. For security purposes, you **must** provide an OAuth access token in the Authorization header to download the recording file using this URL. Example:

```curl --request GET \
  --url {download_url} \
  --header 'authorization: Bearer {access_token} \
  --header 'content-type: application/json'
```

transcript_url.description:
The URL to download the recording transcript. For security purposes, you **must** provide an OAuth access token in the authorization header to download the recording transcript file using this URL. Example:
```curl --request GET 
  --url {transcript_url} 
  --header 'authorization: Bearer {access_token}' 
  --header 'content-type: application/json'
```

playback_url.description:
The URL to play the recording. For security purposes, you **must** provide an OAuth access token in the authorization header to play the recording file using this URL. Example:
```curl --request GET 
  --url {playback_url} 
  --header 'authorization: Bearer {access_token}' 
  --header 'content-type: application/json'
```

recording_start_time.description: The date and time of the recording's start time in ISO 8601 format, either yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z' or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'TZD'.

recording_end_time.description: The date and time of the recording's end time in ISO 8601 format, either yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z' or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'TZD'.

get.description:
Retrieve the Zoom Contact Center management system operation logs report. 

 The Zoom Contact Center management system operation logs report lets account owners and admins view monthly Zoom Contact Center related admin operation details.

**Scopes:** `contact_center_operation_logs:read:admin`

**Granular Scopes:** `contact_center:read:operation_logs:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start time and date in yyyy-mm-dd format. The date range defined by the `from` and `to` parameters should be a month, as the response only includes one month's worth of data at once. If unspecified, returns data within the 24 hours.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: **Required** only when specifying the `from` parameter. The end time and date in **yyyy-mm-dd** format, the same format as the `from` parameter.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Filter the response by the category of the action performed. By default, the value of this field is `all`, and the response includes a log of all operations for the defined period. To only include responses for a specific category type, provide a value for the category from [this table](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/contact-center-api/contact-center-operation-categories/).

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Filter responses according to the type of operation performed. The value of this field is `all`, and the response includes a log of all operations for the defined period.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Filter responses according to `objectName` and operator. The default value is empty, which queries all data.

next_page_token.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token returns when the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned in a single API call.

total_records.description: The total number of all the records available across pages.

operation_logs.description: The array of operation log objects.

time.description: The time when the operation was performed.

operator.description: The user who performed the operation.

Agent routing profile returned

wait_time_agent_in_seconds.description: Wait time for matched agent availability in seconds. Set the minimum time before making an agent who matches the profile available for the queue.

priorities.description: The proficiency priority. The higher priority skill category - with proficiency based skills - takes precedence over those with lower priority. When comparing agents and all else is equal, the agent(s) with the higher proficiency in the higher prioritized skill category should be considered for assignment.

priority_order.description: **Note** This field's values are ordered and unique.  This is the proficiency priority. The higher priority skill category - proficiency based skills - will take precedence over those with lower priority. When comparing agents and all else is equal, the agent(s) with the higher proficiency in the higher prioritized skill category should be considered for assignment.

skill_type.description:
The skill's type. 

* `text` - A text-based skill, such as a geographic location. Skills in this category do not have assigned skill levels. 
* `proficiency` - A proficiency-based skill, such as a second language. Skills in this type of category have assigned proficiency levels.

minimum_proficiency_level.description:
The skill's minimum proficiency level. 

**Note** Only applies to skill proficiency based skill categories. If minimum proficiency is set, agents must have a proficiency equal to or greater than the minimum proficiency value set.

skill_category_required.description: If a skill category is required, agents must have the corresponding skill or they will not be considered for assignment.

schema.description: Information about the agent routing profile detail.

parameters.description: The start time and date in yyyy-mm-dd or ISO 8601 format (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z' or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss’TZD’). total_records.description: The total number of all the records available across pages.

mask_variable_data.description: Mask variable data, for sensitive information.

value_category.description:
The variable value's category. Returned only if `variable_type:global_variable` 
* `undefined` — Each engagement starts without a pre-set value.

post.description:
Create a new variable.

**Granular Scopes:** `contact_center:write:variable:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

address_book_ids.description: The address book IDs. Only valid when `variable_type` is `address_book_variable`, and cannot be empty.

use_in_reporting.description: Whether to use in reporting. Only valid when `variable_type` is `global_variable`.

mask_variable_data.description: Mask variable data, for sensitive information. Only valid when `variable_type` is `global_variable` and the value of data_type is not `boolean`, `date_time`, or `percentage`.

use_as_routing_profile_parameters.description:
Whether to use in the routing profile. Only valid when `variable_type` is `address_book_variable`. 
* `true` — Values are used as routing profile parameters.
* `false` — Not used as a value for routing configuration file parameters.

data_type.description:
The data's type. `variable_type:address_book_variable` only applies to data types with `*`. 
* `string` `*` 
* `number` 
* `boolean` `*` 
* `date_time` 
* `currency` 
* `percentage` 
* `email` 
* `url` 
* `phone` - ([E.164 format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164))

value_category.description:
The variable value's category. Only valid when `variable_type` is `global_variable`.
* `undefined` — Each engagement starts without a pre-set value. 
* `default_value` — Each engagement starts with the default value. 
* `linked_value` — The value links across flows, and each engagement uses the latest value.

values.description: The variable's values. Take only the first value in the array when `variable_type` is `global_variable`.

linked_value_lock.description:
The variable linked value's lock. Only valid when `value_category` is `linked_value`. 
* `true` — The variable can't be updated in a flow. It is the same for each engagement. 
* `false` — The variable value can be updated in a flow. Each engagement uses the latest value.

default_value.description: The variable's default value. Only used when `variable_type` is `address_book_variable` and `data_type` is `string`.

use_in_external_url_parameters.description:
Lets you use the parameter value in defining external URLs launched for each engagement. 

* global
* address book

* address book
